problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

constants.description: List of items with their width and height

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used to pack all items, minimized as objective
Assignment of each item to a box
X and Y positions of each item within its assigned box

constraints:
# -- Constraints --


# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=10, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment),
    positions: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        # Ensure item fits within the box dimensions
        assert positions[i].x + items[i].width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert positions[i].y + items[i].height <= BOX_HEIGHT
        # Ensure assignment consistency
        assert assignments[i].box_id == positions[i].box_id
        assert assignments[i].x == positions[i].x
        assert assignments[i].y == positions[i].y

items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def no_overlap_in_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=10, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check overlap if both items are in the same box
            if positions[i].box_id == positions[j].box_id:
                # Check if rectangles (items) overlap
                assert (
                    positions[i].x >= positions[j].x + items[j].width or
                    positions[j].x >= positions[i].x + items[i].width or
                    positions[i].y >= positions[j].y + items[j].height or
                    positions[j].y >= positions[i].y + items[i].height
                )

no_overlap_in_boxes(ITEMS, x_y_positions)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_item_assignment_consistency(
    assignments: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment),
    positions: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        assert assignments[i].box_id >= 1
        assert assignments[i].box_id <= 10
        assert positions[i].box_id >= 1
        assert positions[i].box_id <= 10
        assert assignments[i].x >= 0
        assert assignments[i].x <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert assignments[i].y >= 0
        assert assignments[i].y <= BOX_HEIGHT
        assert positions[i].x >= 0
        assert positions[i].x <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert positions[i].y >= 0
        assert positions[i].y <= BOX_HEIGHT

ensure_item_assignment_consistency(item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)
full_formulation:
# --- Objects ---


# Object type for items with width and height
Item = DSRecord({
    "width": DSInt(lb=1, ub=11),
    "height": DSInt(lb=1, ub=6)
})

# Object type for box assignments and positions
BoxAssignment = DSRecord({
    "box_id": DSInt(lb=1, ub=10),
    "x": DSInt(lb=0, ub=10),
    "y": DSInt(lb=0, ub=5)
})



# --- Constants and Decision Variables ---
BOX_HEIGHT : int = 6
BOX_WIDTH : int = 11
ITEMS : DSList(length=10, elem_type=Item) = [
    {"width": 4, "height": 4},
    {"width": 11, "height": 3},
    {"width": 4, "height": 2},
    {"width": 5, "height": 5},
    {"width": 11, "height": 3},
    {"width": 2, "height": 5},
    {"width": 4, "height": 2},
    {"width": 3, "height": 5},
    {"width": 3, "height": 4},
    {"width": 1, "height": 1}
]
N_ITEMS : int = 10
nr_used_boxes : DSInt(lb=1, ub=10)
item_box_assignments : DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
x_y_positions : DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
N_ITEMS : int = 10
N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS : int = 10
N_X_Y_POSITIONS : int = 10


# --- objective ---
def calculate_objective(assignments: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment)) -> DSInt(lb=1, ub=10):
    max_box_id: int = 0
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        if assignments[i].box_id > max_box_id:
            max_box_id = assignments[i].box_id
    return max_box_id

objective = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
nr_used_boxes = objective
minimize(objective)

# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---

items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)

constraints:
# -- Constraints --


# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=10, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment),
    box_width: int,
    box_height: int
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        item_width: int = items[i].width
        item_height: int = items[i].height
        pos_x: int = assignments[i].x
        pos_y: int = assignments[i].y
        # Ensure item fits within the box dimensions
        assert pos_x + item_width <= box_width
        assert pos_y + item_height <= box_height
        # Ensure item is placed at non-negative coordinates
        assert pos_x >= 0
        assert pos_y >= 0

items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, BOX_WIDTH, BOX_HEIGHT)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def no_item_overlap(
    items: DSList(length=10, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment),
    box_width: int,
    box_height: int
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check overlap if both items are in the same box
            if assignments[i].box_id == assignments[j].box_id:
                # Extract item dimensions and positions
                w1: int = items[i].width
                h1: int = items[i].height
                x1: int = assignments[i].x
                y1: int = assignments[i].y
                
                w2: int = items[j].width
                h2: int = items[j].height
                x2: int = assignments[j].x
                y2: int = assignments[j].y
                
                # Assert that rectangles do not overlap
                # They overlap if none of the following conditions is true:
                # 1. item1 is to the left of item2
                # 2. item1 is to the right of item2
                # 3. item1 is above item2
                # 4. item1 is below item2
                assert (x1 + w1 <= x2) or (x2 + w2 <= x1) or (y1 + h1 <= y2) or (y2 + h2 <= y1)

no_item_overlap(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, BOX_WIDTH, BOX_HEIGHT)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_item_assignment_to_single_box(
    assignments: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
):
    # Each item must be assigned to exactly one box (enforced by domain of box_id)
    # Just ensure the box_id is within valid range, which is already handled by Field bounds
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        assert assignments[i].box_id >= 1
        assert assignments[i].box_id <= 10

ensure_item_assignment_to_single_box(item_box_assignments)

):

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def no_overlap_in_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=10, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check items in the same box
            if positions[i].box_id == positions[j].box_id:
                # Check for non-overlapping on x-axis
                x_not_overlap: bool = (positions[i].x + items[i].width <= positions[j].x) or \
                                      (positions[j].x + items[j].width <= positions[i].x)
                # Check for non-overlapping on y-axis
                y_not_overlap: bool = (positions[i].y + items[i].height <= positions[j].y) or \
                                      (positions[j].y + items[j].height <= positions[i].y)
                # Assert that at least one axis does not overlap
                assert x_not_overlap or y_not_overlap

no_overlap_in_boxes(ITEMS, x_y_positions)

N_X_Y_POSITIONS : int = 10

def calculate_objective(assignments: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment)) -> DSInt(lb=1, ub=10):

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

X and Y positions of each item within their assigned box

def items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=10, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment),
    box_width: int,
    box_height: int
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        item_width: int = items[i].width
        item_height: int = items[i].height
        pos_x: int = assignments[i].x
        pos_y: int = assignments[i].y
        assigned_box_id: int = assignments[i].box_id

        # Ensure item fits within the box dimensions
        assert pos_x + item_width <= box_width
        assert pos_y + item_height <= box_height

        # Ensure item is placed within valid coordinate bounds
        assert pos_x >= 0
        assert pos_y >= 0
        assert assigned_box_id >= 1
        assert assigned_box_id <= 10

items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, BOX_WIDTH, BOX_HEIGHT)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def no_overlap_in_boxes(
    assignments: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment),
    items: DSList(length=10, elem_type=Item)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check items in the same box
            if assignments[i].box_id == assignments[j].box_id:
                # Extract data for item i
                xi: int = assignments[i].x
                yi: int = assignments[i].y
                wi: int = items[i].width
                hi: int = items[i].height

                # Extract data for item j
                xj: int = assignments[j].x
                yj: int = assignments[j].y
                wj: int = items[j].width
                hj: int = items[j].height

                # No overlap condition: rectangles do not overlap if one is to the left, right, above, or below the other
                assert (xi + wi <= xj) or (xj + wj <= xi) or (yi + hi <= yj) or (yj + hj <= yi)

no_overlap_in_boxes(item_box_assignments, ITEMS)

Global problem:

    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

):

    assignments: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment),
    items: DSList(length=10, elem_type=Item)
):
    for i in range(1, 11):
        for j in range(i + 1, 11):
            assignment_i : BoxAssignment = assignments[i]
            assignment_j : BoxAssignment = assignments[j]
            item_i : Item = items[i]
            item_j : Item = items[j]
            # Check if items are in the same box

                # Check for non-overlapping on x-axis

                    assignment_i.x + item_i.width <= assignment_j.x or

                )
                # Check for non-overlapping on y-axis
                y_overlap : bool = not (
                    assignment_i.y + item_i.height <= assignment_j.y or
                    assignment_j.y + item_j.height <= assignment_i.y
                )
                # If both overlap, then there is a conflict
                assert not (x_overlap and y_overlap)

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

constants.description: List of items to be placed in the box

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used to pack all items, minimized as objective
Assignment of each item to a box including box id and position
X and Y positions of each item within their assigned box

# --- objective ---
def calculate_objective(item_box_assignments: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment)) -> int:
    max_box_id: int = 0
    for i in range(1, N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS + 1):
        box_id: int = item_box_assignments[i].box_id
        if box_id > max_box_id:
            max_box_id = box_id
    return max_box_id

objective = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
nr_used_boxes = objective
minimize(objective)

# -- Constraints --


# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=10, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment),
    box_width: int,
    box_height: int
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        item_w: int = items[i].width
        item_h: int = items[i].height
        pos_x: int = assignments[i].x
        pos_y: int = assignments[i].y
        assigned_box_id: int = assignments[i].box_id
        
        # Ensure item fits within the box dimensions
        assert pos_x + item_w <= box_width
        assert pos_y + item_h <= box_height
        assert pos_x >= 0
        assert pos_y >= 0
        assert assigned_box_id >= 1
        assert assigned_box_id <= 10

items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, BOX_WIDTH, BOX_HEIGHT)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def no_overlap_in_boxes(
    assignments: DSList(length=10, elem_type=BoxAssignment),
    items: DSList(length=10, elem_type=Item)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Retrieve item dimensions
            item_i_w: int = items[i].width
            item_i_h: int = items[i].height
            item_j_w: int = items[j].width
            item_j_h: int = items[j].height

            # Retrieve positions and box IDs
            box_i_id: int = assignments[i].box_id
            x_i: int = assignments[i].x
            y_i: int = assignments[i].y

            box_j_id: int = assignments[j].box_id
            x_j: int = assignments[j].x
            y_j: int = assignments[j].y

            # Check if items are in the same box
            same_box: bool = box_i_id == box_j_id

            # Compute boundaries for overlap check
            left_i: int = x_i
            right_i: int = x_i + item_i_w
            top_i: int = y_i
            bottom_i: int = y_i + item_i_h

            left_j: int = x_j
            right_j: int = x_j + item_j_w
            top_j: int = y_j
            bottom_j: int = y_j + item_j_h

            # Conditions for non-overlapping
            no_overlap: bool = (
                right_i <= left_j or
                right_j <= left_i or
                bottom_i <= top_j or
                bottom_j <= top_i
            )

            # If in the same box, enforce non-overlap
            assert not same_box or no_overlap

no_overlap_in_boxes(item_box_assignments, ITEMS)

        x_pos: int = assignments[i].x
        y_pos: int = assignments[i].y
        assert box_id >= 1
        assert box_id <= 10
        assert x_pos >= 0
        assert y_pos >= 0

ensure_item_box_assignment_validity(item_box_assignments)

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

constants.description: Items to be placed in the box

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used in the end to pack all all items. Minimizing it is the objective.
Which item is assigned to which box.
Position x and y of each item within box

        box_id: int = assignments[i].box_id
        if box_id > max_box_id:
            max_box_id = box_id
    return max_box_id

objective = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
nr_used_boxes = objective
minimize(objective)

):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):

            # Extracting values for clarity, but avoiding temporary variables where possible
            box_i: int = assignments[i].box_id
            box_j: int = assignments[j].box_id
            
            # Only check overlap if items are in the same box
            if box_i == box_j:
